SENT.plain: Hemoglobin (Hb) Sabine is a rare, unstable Hb variant resulting from the point mutation in codon 91 (CTG --> CCG) of beta-globin gene
We report a case of Hb Sabine patient with mild hemolytic anemia, unusually high Hb F level and severe central nervous system thrombotic disturbances
We have tried to elucidate possible genetic background of this unusual Hb Sabine phenotype
Extremely high level of Hb F and rather mild anemia in our patient could be partially explained by the presence of G gamma Xmn I polymorphism
This case of Hb Sabine, unlike all other reported to date, shows extremely severe thromboembolic complications
It is our opinion that the hypercoagulable state described in thalassemia is not the only factor responsible for this specific clinical state
The presence of MTHFR C677T mutation in heterozygous state found in our patient and unstable Hb Sabine molecules could contribute to development of thromboembolic phenomena
However, it remains unclear whether other factors participate in pathogenesis of the disease
In this paper we emphasize different genetic background of father and son both affected with Hb Sabine, but with markedly different severity of the disease
